00033 /****************************************************************************

00035  ****************************************************************************/

00037 #ifdef  ARROW_DEBUG
00038     #define arrow_debug printf
00039 #else
00040     #define arrow_debug
00041 #endif

00044 /****************************************************************************
00045  *  Error reporting macro
00046  ****************************************************************************/
00047 #define arrow_print_error(args...) \
00048     fprintf(stderr, "%s:%d: ", __FILE__, __LINE__); fprintf(stderr, args); \
00049     fprintf(stderr, "\n")

00058 #define ARROW_FAILURE 0
00059 #define ARROW_TRUE 1
00060 #define ARROW_FALSE 0
00061 #define ARROW_PROBLEM_NAME_LENGTH 64
00062 #define ARROW_HASH_BUFFER_LENGTH 16

00077 /****************************************************************************
00078  *  bintree.c
00079  ****************************************************************************/
00080 /**
00081  *  @brief  Binary tree data structure.
00082  */
00083 typedef struct arrow_bintree
00084 {
00085     struct arrow_bintree_node *root_node;   /**< root node of tree */
00086     int size;                               /**< size of tree */
00087 } arrow_bintree;
00088 
00089 /**
00090  *  @brief  Binary tree node.
00091  */
00092 typedef struct arrow_bintree_node
00093 {
00094     int data;                               /**< data contained in node */
00095     int has_left_node;                      /**< true if left node exists */
00096     int has_right_node;                     /**< true if right node exists */
00097     struct arrow_bintree_node *left_node;   /**< left node */
00098     struct arrow_bintree_node *right_node;  /**< right node */
00099 } arrow_bintree_node;
00100 
00101 /**
00102  *  @brief  Initializes the binary tree data structure.
00103  *  @param  tree [out] binary tree structure
00104  */
00105 void
00106 arrow_bintree_init(arrow_bintree *tree);
00107 
00108 /**
00109  *  @brief  Destructs a binary tree data structure.
00110  *  @param  tree [out] binary tree structure
00111  */
00112 void
00113 arrow_bintree_destruct(arrow_bintree *tree);
00114 
00115 /**
00116  *  @brief  Inserts a value into the binary tree.
00117  *  @param  tree [out] binary tree structure
00118  *  @param  value [in] value to insert into tree
00119  */
00120 int
00121 arrow_bintree_insert(arrow_bintree *tree, int value);
00122 
00123 /**
00124  *  @brief  Initializes the binary tree data structure into an existing array.
00125  *  @param  tree [out] binary tree structure
00126  *  @param  array [out] array to be filled
00127  */
00128 void
00129 arrow_bintree_to_array(arrow_bintree *tree, int *array);
00130 
00131 /**
00132  *  @brief  Initializes the binary tree data structure into a new array.
00133  *  @param  tree [out] binary tree structure
00134  *  @param  array [out] array to be created and filled
00135  */
00136 int
00137 arrow_bintree_to_new_array(arrow_bintree *tree, int **array);
00138 
00139 /**
00140  *  @brief  Prints out the values of the binary tree.
00141  *  @param  tree [in] binary tree structure
00142  */ 
00143 void
00144 arrow_bintree_print(arrow_bintree *tree);

00147 /****************************************************************************
00148  *  hash.c
00149  ****************************************************************************/
00150 /**
00151  *  @brief  Hashtable
00152  */
00153 typedef struct arrow_hash
00154 {
00155     cmph_uint32 num_keys;       /**< number of keys in hashtable */
00156     char **vector;              /**< array of strings (vectors) */
00157     char *vector_space;         /**< memory space for strings */
00158     cmph_io_adapter_t *source;  /**< CMPH hash source data */
00159     cmph_t *data;               /**< CMPH hash data */
00160 } arrow_hash;
00161 
00162 /**
00163  *  @brief  Creates a hash table from a list of unique costs
00164  *  @param  cost_list [in] list of costs
00165  *  @param  cost_list_length [in] length of cost list
00166  *  @param  hash [out] hashtable data structure
00167  */ 
00168 int
00169 arrow_hash_cost_list(int *cost_list, int cost_list_length, arrow_hash *hash);
00170 
00171 /**
00172  *  @brief  Destructs a hashtable data structure.
00173  *  @param  hash [out] hashtable data structure
00174  */
00175 void
00176 arrow_hash_destruct(arrow_hash *hash);
00177 
00178 /**
00179  *  @brief  Finds id associated with key in hashtable
00180  *  @param  hash [in] hash table data structure
00181  *  @param  key [in] key to look up
00182  *  @return the id of the associated key
00183  */
00184 unsigned int
00185 arrow_hash_search(arrow_hash *hash, int key);

00188 /****************************************************************************
00189  *  heap.c
00190  ****************************************************************************/
00191 /**
00192  *  @brief  Binary heap
00193  */
00194 typedef struct arrow_heap
00195 {
00196     int *keys;
00197     int *values;
00198     int *pos;
00199     int size;
00200     int max_size;
00201 } arrow_heap;
00202 
00203 /**
00204  *  @brief  Initializes a new binary heap.
00205  *  @param  heap [out] heap structure
00206  *  @param  max_size [in] maximum size of heap
00207  */
00208 int
00209 arrow_heap_init(arrow_heap *heap, int max_size);
00210 
00211 /**
00212  *  @brief  Destructs a binary heap.
00213  *  @param  heap [out] heap structure
00214  */
00215 void
00216 arrow_heap_destruct(arrow_heap *heap);
00217 
00218 /**
00219  *  @brief  Empties the heap of items.
00220  *  @param  heap [out] heap structure
00221  */
00222 void
00223 arrow_heap_empty(arrow_heap *heap);
00224 
00225 /**
00226  *  @brief  Inserts a new (key,value) pair into the heap.
00227  *  @param  heap [out] heap structure
00228  *  @param  key [in] key to insert
00229  *  @param  value [in] value to insert -- must be between 0 and [n-1] and
00230  *              not a duplicate value.
00231  */
00232 int
00233 arrow_heap_insert(arrow_heap *heap, int key, int value);
00234 
00235 /**
00236  *  @brief  Determines if the given value is present in the heap.
00237  *  @param  heap [in] heap structure
00238  *  @param  value [in] value to check
00239  *  @return True or false, if the value is present in the heap
00240  */
00241 int
00242 arrow_heap_in(arrow_heap *heap, int value);
00243 
00244 /**
00245  *  @brief  Changes the key for the given value in the heap.
00246  *  @param  heap [out] heap structure
00247  *  @param  key [in] the new key
00248  *  @param  value [in] node value to change
00249  */
00250 void
00251 arrow_heap_change_key(arrow_heap *heap, int key, int value);
00252 
00253 /**
00254  *  @brief  Returns the value with the smallest key in the heap.
00255  *  @brief  heap [in] heap structure
00256  *  @return The value with the smallest key in the heap.
00257  */
00258 inline int
00259 arrow_heap_get_min(arrow_heap *heap);
00260 
00261 /**
00262  *  @brief  Removes the value with the smallest key from the heap.
00263  *  @brief  heap [out] heap structure
00264  */
00265 void
00266 arrow_heap_delete_min(arrow_heap *heap);
00267 
00268 /**
00269  *  @brief  Prints heap structure
00270  *  @brief  heap [in] heap structure
00271  */
00272 void
00273 arrow_heap_print(arrow_heap *heap);

00276 /****************************************************************************
00277  *  llist.c
00278  ****************************************************************************/
00279 /**
00280  *  @brief  Linked list item
00281  */
00282 typedef struct arrow_llist_item
00283 {
00284     int data;                       /**< list item data */
00285     struct arrow_llist_item *next;  /**< next item in list */
00286 } arrow_llist_item;
00287 
00288 /**
00289  *  @brief  Linked list data structure
00290  */
00291 typedef struct arrow_llist
00292 {
00293     struct arrow_llist_item *head;  /**< head item in list */
00294     struct arrow_llist_item *tail;  /**< tail item in list */
00295     int size;                       /**< size of list */
00296 } arrow_llist;
00297 
00298 /**
00299  *  @brief  Initializes a new linked list
00300  *  @param  list [out] linked list structure
00301  */
00302 void
00303 arrow_llist_init(arrow_llist *list);
00304 
00305 /**
00306  *  @brief  Destructs contents of a linked list
00307  *  @param  list [out] list structure
00308  */
00309 void
00310 arrow_llist_destruct(arrow_llist *list);
00311 
00312 /**
00313  *  @brief  Swaps the two given lists.
00314  *  @param  a [out] the first list
00315  *  @param  b [out] the second list
00316  */
00317 void
00318 arrow_llist_swap(arrow_llist *a, arrow_llist *b);
00319 
00320 /**
00321  *  @brief  Inserts a new item at the head of the list
00322  *  @param  list [out] linked list structure
00323  *  @param  value [in] value to insert
00324  */
00325 int
00326 arrow_llist_insert_head(arrow_llist *list, int value); 
00327 
00328 /**
00329  *  @brief  Inserts a new item at the tail of the list
00330  *  @param  list [out] linked list structure
00331  *  @param  value [in] value to insert
00332  */
00333 int
00334 arrow_llist_insert_tail(arrow_llist *list, int value);
00335 
00336 /**
00337  *  @brief  Inserts a new item after the given item in the list. NOTE:
00338  *          procedure makes no attempt to verify given item is in the list!
00339  *  @param  list [out] linked list structure
00340  *  @param  item [in] linked list item
00341  *  @param  value [in] value to insert
00342  */
00343 int
00344 arrow_llist_insert_after(arrow_llist *list, arrow_llist_item *item, 
00345                          int value);
00346 
00347 /**
00348  *  @brief  Removes the head item in the list. 
00349  *  @param  list [out] linked list structure
00350  *  @param  value [out] value of removed item
00351  */
00352 void
00353 arrow_llist_remove_head(arrow_llist *list, int *value);
00354 
00355 /**
00356  *  @brief  Removes the tail item in the list.  NOTE: O(n) procedure!
00357  *  @param  list [out] linked list structure
00358  *  @param  value [out] value of removed item
00359  */
00360 void
00361 arrow_llist_remove_tail(arrow_llist *list, int *value);
00362 
00363 /**
00364  *  @brief  Removes the item after the given one in the list. NOTE:
00365  *          procedure makes no attempt to verify given item is in the list!
00366  *  @param  list [out] linked list structure
00367  *  @param  item [in] linked list item
00368  *  @param  value [out] value of removed item
00369  */
00370 void
00371 arrow_llist_remove_after(arrow_llist *list, arrow_llist_item *item, 
00372                          int *value);
00373                          
00374 /**
00375  *  @brief  Prints a list of items in the list. 
00376  *  @param  list [in] linked list structure
00377  */
00378 void
00379 arrow_llist_print(arrow_llist *list);
00380 
00381 /**
00382  *  @brief  Copys data from linked list into array.  Assume array is big
00383  *          enough to handle linked list!
00384  *  @param  list [in] linked list structure
00385  *  @param  array [out] array to copy items into
00386  */
00387 void
00388 arrow_llist_to_array(arrow_llist *list, int *array);

00391 /****************************************************************************
00392  *  options.c
00393  ****************************************************************************/
00394 /**
00395  *  @brief  Program options structure
00396  */
00397 typedef struct arrow_option
00398 {
00399     char short_option;              /**< short option (flag) */
00400     const char *long_option;        /**< long option */
00401     const char *help_message;       /**< help message to display for option */
00402     int data_type;                  /**< one of ARROW_OPTION_INT, 
00403                                          ARROW_OPTION_DOUBLE, 
00404                                         ARROW_OPTION_STRING */
00405     void *data_ptr;          /**< pointer to variable to hold parameter */
00406     int opt_required;       /**< if true ensures option is present */
00407     int arg_required;       /**< if true, ensures argument for parameter
00408                                  passed, otherwise puts 1 into data_ptr if
00409                                  parameter is present */
00410 } arrow_option;
00411 
00412 /**
00413  *  @brief  Parses program options
00414  *  @param  num_opts [in] the number of program options
00415  *  @param  options [out] array of program options
00416  *  @param  description [in] description of program
00417  *  @param  usage [in] usage message
00418  *  @param  argc [in] number of program arguments
00419  *  @param  argv [out] array of program arguments (might be rearranged)
00420  *  @param  opt_ind [out] index first program option appears at
00421  */
00422 int
00423 arrow_options_parse(int num_opts, arrow_option options[],  char *description, 
00424                     char *usage, int argc, char *argv[], int *opt_ind);
00425 
00426 
00427 /****************************************************************************
00428  *  problem.c
00429  ****************************************************************************/
00430 /**
00431  *  @brief  Problem data structure.
00432  */
00433 typedef struct arrow_problem
00434 {
00435     int size;           /**< problem size */
00436     int type;           /**< problem type */
00437     int symmetric;      /**< indicates if cost matrix is symmetric */
00438     int shallow;        /**< indicates use of shallow copy of data */
00439     int fixed_edges;    /**< number of fixed edges */
00440     char name[ARROW_PROBLEM_NAME_LENGTH]; /**< problem name */
00441     void *data;         /**< Pointer to structure for problem data. */
00442         
00443     /**
00444      *  @brief  Returns the cost between node i and node j.
00445      *  @param  this [in] problem data
00446      *  @param  i [in] node i
00447      *  @param  j [in] node j
00448      *  @return cost between node i and j.
00449      */
00450     int 
00451     (*get_cost)(struct arrow_problem *this, int i, int j);
00452     
00453     /**
00454      *  @brief  Frees problem data structure.
00455      *  @param  this [in] problem data
00456      */
00457     void 
00458     (*destruct)(struct arrow_problem *this);
00459 } arrow_problem;
00460 
00461 /**
00462  *  @brief  Problem information data structure.
00463  */
00464 typedef struct arrow_problem_info
00465 {
00466     int *cost_list;         /**< sorted list of unique costs from problem. */
00467     int cost_list_length;   /**< length of cost list. */
00468     int min_cost;           /**< smallest cost in problem. */
00469     int max_cost;           /**< largest cost in problem. */
00470     arrow_hash hash;       /**< hash table structure */
00471 } arrow_problem_info;
00472 
00473 /**
00474  *  @brief  Reads a problem from a TSPLIB file.
00475  *  @param  file_name [in] path to TSPLIB file
00476  *  @param  problem [out] problem data structure
00477  */
00478 int
00479 arrow_problem_read(char *file_name, arrow_problem *problem);
00480 
00481 /**
00482  *  @brief  Deallocates problem data structure.
00483  *  @param  problem [out] problem data structure
00484  */
00485 void
00486 arrow_problem_destruct(arrow_problem *problem);
00487 
00488 /**
00489  *  @brief  Builds ordered cost list and finds min/max cost in a problem.
00490  *  @param  problem [in] problem data structure
00491  *  @param  create_hash [in] if true will also create hash table of cost list 
00492  *  @param  info [out] problem info data structure
00493  */
00494 int
00495 arrow_problem_info_get(arrow_problem *problem, int create_hash,
00496                        arrow_problem_info *info);
00497 
00498 /**
00499  *  @brief  Deallocates problem info data structure.
00500  *  @param  info [in] problem info data structure
00501  */
00502 void
00503 arrow_problem_info_destruct(arrow_problem_info *info);
00504 
00505 /**
00506  *  @brief  Finds the position of the given cost into the sorted list
00507  *  @param  info [in] problem info data structure
00508  *  @param  cost [in] cost to look up
00509  *  @param  pos [out] position of given cost in sorted list
00510  */
00511 int
00512 arrow_problem_info_cost_index(arrow_problem_info *info, int cost, int *pos);
00513 
00514 /**
00515  *  @brief  Finds the largest cost in a problem (cheaper than calling
00516             arrow_problem_info_get)
00517  *  @param  problem [in] problem data structure
00518  *  @return The largest cost in the problem.
00519  */
00520 int
00521 arrow_problem_max_cost(arrow_problem *problem);
00522 
00523 /**
00524  *  @brief  Prints out information about a problem.
00525  *  @param  problem [in] problem data structure
00526  *  @param  pretty [in] if ARROW_TRUE, formats output to 8 nodes/row
00527  */
00528 void
00529 arrow_problem_print(arrow_problem *problem, int pretty);
00530 
00531 /**
00532  *  @brief  Reads a TSPLIB tour file
00533  *  @param  file_name [in] the TSPLIB tour file to read
00534  *  @param  size [in] the number of cities in the tour
00535  *  @param  tour [out] an array to hold the tour in node-node format
00536  */
00537 int
00538 arrow_problem_read_tour(char *file_name, int size, int *tour);
00539 
00540 /**
00541  *      @brief  Transforms an asymmetric BTSP problem of n nodes into a symmetric
00542  *                      BTSP problem with 2n nodes.
00543  *  @param  shallow [in] if true only a shallow copy of data will be created
00544  *  @param  old_problem [in] the asymmetric problem
00545  *      @param  infinity [in] value to use as "infinity"
00546  *      @param  new_problem [out] the new symmetric problem
00547  */
00548 int
00549 arrow_problem_abtsp_to_sbtsp(int shallow, arrow_problem *old_problem,  
00550                              int infinity, arrow_problem *new_problem);
00551 
00552 /**
00553  *      @brief  Transforms a MSTSP problem into the equivalent BTSP problem.
00554  *  @param  shallow [in] if true only a shallow copy of data will be created
00555  *  @param  old_problem [in] the MSTSP problem
00556  *      @param  max_cost [in] the maximum cost in old_problem
00557  *      @param  new_problem [out] the new BTSP problem
00558  */
00559 int
00560 arrow_problem_mstsp_to_btsp(int shallow, arrow_problem *old_problem,
00561                             int max_cost, arrow_problem *new_problem);
00562

00582 inline int
00583 arrow_util_create_int_matrix(int rows, int cols, int ***matrix, int **space);

00627 /**

00629  *          Concorde that is ready to be filled in with values.

00633 int

00636 /**
00637  *  @brief  Performs a binary search to find the wanted element in a
00638  *          sorted integer array.
00639  *  @param  array [in] the array to search (note: must be sorted in
00640  *              non-increasing order)
00641  *  @param  size [in] size of the array
00642  *  @param  element [in] the element to find in the array
00643  *  @param  pos [out] the index where the element can be found in the array
00644  */
00645 int
00646 arrow_util_binary_search(int *array, int size, int element, int *pos);
00647 
00648 /**
00649  *      @brief  Determines if the given string turns up a match for the given
00650  *                      regular expression pattern.
00651  *      @param  string [in] the string to match against
00652  *      @param  pattern [in] the regular expression pattern to match
00653  *      @return ARROW_TRUE if a match is found, ARROW_FALSE if not.
00654  */
00655 int
00656 arrow_util_regex_match(char *string, char *pattern);

00658 /**
00659  *  @brief  Prints out the given program arguments to the specified file.
00660  *  @param  argc [in] the number of arguments
00661  *  @param  argv [in] the program arugment array
00662  *  @param  out [in] the file handle to print out to
00663  */
00664 void
00665 arrow_util_print_program_args(int argc, char *argv[], FILE *out);
00666 
00667 /**
00668  *  @brief  Seeds the random number generator.  Pass a value of 0 to seed
00669  *          with the current time.
00670  *  @param  seed [in] the random number seed.
00671  */
00672 void
00673 arrow_util_random_seed(int seed);
00674 
00675 /**
00676  *  @brief  Returns a random number between 0 and RAND_MAX (normally,
00677  *          RAND_MAX = INT_MAX).
00678  *  @return a random integer.
00679  */
00680 inline int
00681 arrow_util_random();
00682 
00683 /**
00684  *  @brief  Returns a random number between min and max.
00685  *  @param  min [in] the minimum random number to return
00686  *  @param  max [in] the maximum random number to return
00687  *  @return a random integer in the range [min, max]
00688  */
00689 inline int
00690 arrow_util_random_between(int min, int max);

00695  *  @param  array [out] the array to permute.

00704  *  @param  tour [in] the tour to print out.

00708 arrow_util_write_tour(arrow_problem *problem, char *comment, int *tour, 
00709                       FILE *out);

00711 /**

00713  *  @param  problem [in] problem associated with tour.
00714  *  @param  old_tour [in] the symmetric tour.
00715  *  @param  new_tour [out] the asymmetric tour.
00716  */

00718 arrow_util_sbtsp_to_abstp_tour(arrow_problem *problem, int *old_tour,
00719                                int *new_tour);

00725  *  @param  out [out] the file descriptor id to print out to.
